name: Argostemma bicolor
description: Argostemma bicolor is a small terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and features small, oval to lance-shaped, dark green leaves (2-5 cm long) arranged on short stems. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers. The plant displays an upright, compact growth habit and typically reaches 10-20 cm in height. In its native habitat, it grows as an understory plant in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its compact form. It's popular among plant enthusiasts for its small size and attractive flowers.
